title: fstr_type deprecated in Catboost
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to run the following dummy example:
```python
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor
import shap
X,y = shap.datasets.boston()

model = CatBoostRegressor(iterations=300, learning_rate=0.1, random_seed=123)
model.fit(X, y, verbose=False, plot=False)
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)
```
But I get the following
```python

AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)

<ipython-input-1-c119d4ef4c26> in <module>
      6 model.fit(X, y, verbose=False, plot=False)
      7 explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
----> 8 shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)

~/src/research-incubation/catboost-cvr/.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/tree.py in shap_values(self, X, y, tree_limit, approximate)
    195             # note we pull off the last column and keep it as our expected_value
    196             if phi is not None:
--> 197                 if len(phi.shape) == 3:
    198                     self.expected_value = [phi[0, i, -1] for i in range(phi.shape[1])]
    199                     return [phi[:, i, :-1] for i in range(phi.shape[1])]

AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'shape'
```
Looking into this I see that keeping the [fstr_type](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/explainers/tree.py#L188) param leads the output to be a list:
```
> Xp = Pool(X)
> type(model.get_feature_importance(data=Xp, fstr_type='ShapValues'))
list
```
Where with the correct param name you have an array:
```
> type(model.get_feature_importance(data=Xp, type='ShapValues'))
numpy.ndarray
```
I'm using shap 0.28.5 and catboost 0.13 where apparently the fstr_type was [deprecacted](https://catboost.ai/docs/concepts/r-reference_catboost-get_feature_importance.html)
